semantic_title: Transplanted Organ Removal Status (Z98.85) - Usage and Timing Requirements
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Factors Influencing Health Status > c. Categories of Z Codes > 3) Status

content.full_text: Assign code Z98.85, Transplanted organ removal status, to indicate that a transplanted organ has been previously removed. This code should not be assigned for the encounter in which the transplanted organ is removed. The complication necessitating removal of the transplant organ should be assigned for that encounter. See section I.C.19. for information on the coding of organ transplant complications. (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87-L88)
content.summary: Z98.85 indicates previous transplanted organ removal, not used during removal encounter, with complications coded for removal encounter (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87-L88)
key_concepts: Previously removed transplanted organ (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87)
Not for current removal encounter (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87)
Complication coded for removal encounter (Evidence: pg no: 96, L88)
Cross-reference to transplant complications (Evidence: pg no: 96, L88)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use to indicate transplanted organ was previously removed (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87)
detailed_rules.explanation: Z98.85 should be assigned to indicate that a transplanted organ has been removed in the past (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not assign for encounter when organ is being removed (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87)
detailed_rules.explanation: Z98.85 should not be used during the actual encounter when the transplanted organ is being removed (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code complication necessitating removal for removal encounter (Evidence: pg no: 96, L88)
detailed_rules.explanation: During the encounter when organ is removed, code the complication that necessitated the removal rather than Z98.85 (Evidence: pg no: 96, L88)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine timing of organ removal relative to current encounter
Step 2: If previous removal, assign Z98.85
Step 3: If current removal, code the complication necessitating removal
Step 4: Reference Section I.C.19 for transplant complications

specific_codes.description: Transplanted organ removal status (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87)
specific_codes.context: Use for previously removed transplanted organs, not current removal

references_to.title: Coding of organ transplant complications
references_to.explanation: Provides guidance on coding transplant complications during removal encounters

coding_scenarios.scenario: Follow-up visit after previous kidney transplant removal
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient for routine follow-up. History of kidney transplant removed 6 months ago due to chronic rejection.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify this is follow-up after previous removal
Step 2: Assign Z98.85 for transplant removal status
Step 3: Add appropriate follow-up or encounter codes

correct_coding.sequencing: Follow-up encounter first, then removal status
correct_coding.rationale: Z98.85 indicates organ was previously removed (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87)

incorrect_coding.rationale: This is follow-up after removal, not current complication
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using complication codes for previous removal

coding_scenarios.scenario: Current encounter for heart transplant removal due to rejection
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient admitted for removal of heart transplant due to chronic rejection.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify this is current removal encounter
Step 2: Do not use Z98.85 for current removal
Step 3: Code the complication necessitating removal
Step 4: Reference Section I.C.19 for transplant complications

correct_coding.sequencing: Complication code for current removal encounter
correct_coding.rationale: Code complication necessitating removal, not Z98.85 (Evidence: pg no: 96, L88)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not use Z98.85 for current removal encounter
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using Z98.85 during actual removal encounter

warnings: Do not use for current removal encounter (Evidence: pg no: 96, L87)
Code complications for removal encounter instead (Evidence: pg no: 96, L88)
best_practices: Distinguish between current and previous removal
Reference Section I.C.19 for transplant complications
Use appropriate timing for code assignment
common_mistakes: Not coding complications for removal encounter
tips: Focus on timing - previous vs. current removal
Remember to code complications during removal
